Event.Message: The backup catalog is corrupted. Please recover the catalog from a backup using the Windows Server Backup snap-in or the WBADMIN RESTORE CATALOG command.
The backup catalog on the selected disk '%1' is corrupted so that you will not be able to perform a recovery operation from this location. Please choose a different backup storage location.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="TargetDeviceName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Please review the event details for a solution, and then rerun the backup operation once the issue is resolved.

Event.Message: There is no backup available on the storage location. Please confirm that the storage location is not corrupted, and then create a new backup that you can use to perform a recovery from the storage location.

The backup of volume '%2' on the backup storage location is corrupted. Run CHKDSK /R to determine if the storage location itself is corrupted. If needed, replace the disk or change the storage location, and then create a new backup that can be used to perform a recovery.
Event.Template: <template xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events"> <data name="BackupSetId" inType="win:GUID" outType="xs:GUID"/> <data name="VolumeFriendlyName" inType="win:UnicodeString" outType="xs:string"/> </template>

Event.Message: The backup has some corrupted application metadata and cannot be used to perform a recovery. Run CHKDSK /R to determine if the storage location itself is corrupted. Event.Message: The backup operation has completed with warning(s) - Volume '%2' has developed new bad clusters.
